members.description: Indicates whether a fatal level log event will be processed by a log target.

values: true if a fatal level log event will be logged; otherwise false.

members.description: Indicates whether an error level log event will be processed by a log target.

values: true if an error level log event will be logged; otherwise false.

members.description: Indicates whether a warn level log event will be processed by a log target.

values: true if a warn level log event will be logged; otherwise false.

members.description: Indicates whether an info level log event will be processed by a log target.

values: true if an info level log event will be logged; otherwise false.

members.description: Indicates whether a debug level log event will be processed by a log target.

values: true if a debug level log event will be logged; otherwise false.

members.description: Allows the specified target to begin receiving notification of log events.

values: The specific target that should capture log events.

members.description: Stops the specified target from receiving notification of log events.

values: The specific target that should capture log events.

members.description: Returns the logger associated with the specified category. If the category given doesn't exist a new instance of a logger will be returned and associated with that category. Categories must be at least one character in length and may not contain any blanks or any of the following characters: []~$^&\/(){}<>+=`!#%?,:;'"@ This method will throw an InvalidCategoryError if the category specified is malformed. If the name doesn't exist, a new instance with the specified name is returned.

values: category The category of the logger that should be returned.
An instance of a logger object for the specified name.

members.description: This method removes all of the current loggers from the cache. Subsquent calls to the getLogger() method return new instances of loggers rather than any previous instances with the same category. This method is intended for use in debugging only.
This method checks the specified string value for illegal characters. The following characters are not valid: []~$^&\/(){}<>+=`!#%?,:;'"@ false otherwise

values: value The String to check for illegal characters.
true if there are any illegal characters found,
